properties.Title: Man with drinking horn reclining on a wineskin
properties.Description:
Man with drinking horn reclining on a wineskin
Greek, mid-6th century BCE
Bronze
Height: 13 cm (5 1/8 in.); length: 19.5 cm (7 11/16 in.)
From Didyma (Turkey)
Antikensammlung, Staatliche Museen zu Berlin, Didyma 110 (formerly Sa. 116 Br)
bpk Bildagentur/

properties.Title: Boar-Shaped Cup
properties.Description:
Boar-shaped cup
Greek, Boeotian, 575–550 BCE
Terracotta, black-figure technique

bpk Bildagentur/Antikensa

properties.Title: Trick Vase
properties.Description:
Trick vase with bull head spout
Cypriot, 750–600 BCE
Painted terracotta, Bichrome ware
Height: 21 cm (8 1/4 in.)
From Cyprus
Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, The Cesnola Collection, Purchase by subscription, 1874–76, 74.51.584
© The Metropolita

properties.Title: Beak-Spouted Pitcher
properties.Description:

Museo Ar

properties.Title: Amphora pitcher with zoomorphic handles

National Archaeological Institute with M

properties.Title: Ram Head Cup
properties.Description:

From Tomb 86 at Enkomi (Cyprus)
Faience

The British Museum, London, Excavated by the Turner Bequest Excavations, 1897,0401.1212

properties.Title: Fragmentary ram-headed beaker
properties.Description:

Neo-Assyrian, 8th–7th century BCE

properties.Title: Ram head mug depicting symposium of the mythical kings of Athens
properties.Description:
Ram head mug depicting symposium of the mythical kings of Athens
Signed by the potter Charinos, attributed to the Triptolemos Painter
Greek, Attic, c. 480 BCE
Terracotta, red-figure technique
22.5 × 14 × 26.7 cm (8 7/8 × 5 1/2 × 10 1/2 in.)
Virginia

properties.Title: Lion-headed mug depicting revelers

Terracotta, red-figure technique
Height: 14.4 cm (5 11/16 in.); diameter: 8.7 cm (3 7/16 in.)
Musée du Louvre, Paris, H 65 (MNB 1294)
